ygData.subject: Re: New term for twisting
ygData.msgSnippet: Flipping Interleaving Mixing Cycling Gyrating Rotating and for the Star Trek crowd: Transchordulation (through the deflector dish). Laluni 22nd Level Bard of
ygData.messageBody:
Flipping

Interleaving

Mixing

Cycling

Gyrating

Rotating


and for the Star Trek crowd:


Transchordulation (through the deflector dish).


Laluni

22nd Level Bard of E'Ci




At 07:20 PM 7/8/99 -0500, you wrote:

>>>>

<excerpt><bigger> Come on people - we should be more creative that
just coming up with two ideas!</bigger><fontfamily><param>Arial</param>
<bigger> My apologies if anyone takes this personally, but, I think
"Juggling" and "Weaving" are just as bad (well maybe slightly less so)
than "Twisting". I'm not a clown; I'm not a textile worker as well as
not being a gymnast. I'm a musician.</bigger> <bigger> The term I
like: "Riffing"... It seems to me - that we are playing five or six
seconds of a song - so it would basically just be a riff... Musically
speaking, of course, "riffs" are associated more with instrumental music
than vocal music - but I think it fits a hell of a lot better than
twisting, juggling, weaving, or heaven-forbid "medlying"</bigger>
<bigger>Slyde of Xegony</bigger> <bigger>Level 18 Bard</bigger>
<bigger><<Army of Virtue></bigger>

</fontfamily></excerpt><fontfamily><param>Arial</param>


</fontfamily>

Steven S. Klug

-- sklug@...
